subtitle: These unusual sweet pasta patties are surprisingly tasty and make a rather interesting dessert when entertaining.

method.text: Place the pasta shapes in a pan of boiling water. Return to boil then simmer for 2-3 min until al dente. Drain thoroughly and leave to cool.
Meanwhile, preheat a medium grill. Toast the hazelnuts lightly under the grill for 2-3 min until golden brown. Transfer to a chopping board and finely chop.
In a bowl, beat together the cream cheese and sugar. Stir in the drained pasta and chopped hazelnuts.
Divide the mixture into 8 equal round balls then flatten into neat rounds. Dip the rounds into the beaten egg, shake off any excess, and roll each in the breadcrumbs until well coated.
Heat the oil in a frying pan or deep fat fryer to 180°C / 350F. Fry the rounds for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown.
Place the raspberries and sugar in a food processor. Process until smooth. Spoon onto serving plates. Sprinkly over a little icing sugar.
Drain the rounds thoroughly and arrange in the sauce. Decorate with the mint and serve immediately.

title: Hazelnut pasta rounds with raspberry sauce
